intro: Moehringia pentandra, commonly known as the five-angled moehringia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has basal leaves that are deeply lobed and hairy, often with a reddish or purplish hue. Its fruit is a dry capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Moehringia pentandra thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
